result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor Joseph Sanigar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Trevor Joseph Sanigar is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Trevor Joseph Sanigar was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:04 PM Defendant Trevor Joseph Sanigar in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Trevor Joseph Sanigar.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates defendant will plea do count 1. Joint recommendation of 90 days consecutive to any other sentence, $20 plus costs.  Attorney Hoffman indicates he has 40 days credit. 
Court recounts charges and possible penalties. Defendant pleads no contest. Court informs defendant of rights given up by their plea. Attorney stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. Court finds Defendant understands all the rights they are waiving by their plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered. Count 2 is dismissed. 
Court orders 90 days, 40 days credit, $20 plus costs, 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:22 AM Defendant Trevor Joseph Sanigar in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Trevor Joseph Sanigar.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Court received speedy trial demand and sets for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

2:02 PM Defendant Trevor Joseph Sanigar appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Attorney Chad LaLor n court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Address verified as correct. Receives complaint, waives reading, pleads not guilty. Court accepts plea.
State requests $2500 cash, conditions of no use or possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Cites priors and prior FTA's. 
Hoffman indicates lifelong resident of Douglas County. Not currently working. Could post $200.
Court orders $1,250 cash, with conditions of no use or possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
